translated: Therefore, one should not disturb what is done by them at any time.

original: grāmayor ubhayor yatra maryādā kalpitā nadī /
analyzed: grāmayoḥ ubhayoḥ yatra maryādā kalpitā nadī
translated: Where a river has been designated as the boundary between two villages,

original: kurute dānaharaṇaṃ bhāgyābhāgyavaśān nṛṇām /
analyzed: kurute dāna haraṇam bhāgya abhāgya vaśāt nṛṇām
translated: It makes people give and take gifts according to their good and bad fortune.

original: kṣayodayena cālpā ca cālayan daṇḍam arhati // / / //
analyzed: kṣaya udayena ca alpā ca cālayan daṇḍam arhati
translated: And by the rise and fall of the river, it is small and deserves to be moved.

original: daśagrāmaśatagrāma sahasragrāmalakṣaṇām /
analyzed: daśa grāma śata grāma sahasra grāma lakṣaṇām
translated: Marked by ten villages, a hundred villages, and a thousand villages,

original: viṣamāṃ nṛpatiḥ kuryāc cihnaiḥ sīmāṃ viniścitām // / / //
analyzed: viṣamām nṛpatiḥ kuryāt cihnaiḥ sīmām viniścitām
translated: The king should make an uneven boundary determined by signs.

original: niveśakālād ārabhya gṛhavaryāpaṇādikam /
analyzed: niveśa kālāt ārabhya gṛha varya āpaṇa ādikam
translated: Starting from the time of settlement, the best house, shop, etc.,

original: yena yāvad yathā bhuktaṃ tasya tan na vicālayet // / / //
analyzed: yena yāvat yathā bhuktam tasya tat na vicālayet
translated: By whom and how much was enjoyed, that should not be disturbed.

original: vātāyanapraṇālīs tu tathā niryūhavedikāḥ /
analyzed: vātāyana praṇālīḥ tu tathā niryūha vedikāḥ
translated: Windows, gutters, and also balconies,

original: catuḥśālasyandanikāḥ prāṅniviṣṭā na cālayet // / / //
analyzed: catuḥśāla syandanikāḥ prāc niviṣṭāḥ na cālayet
translated: The four-courtyard and the porch, previously constructed, should not be disturbed.

original: mekhalābhramaniṣkāsa gavākṣān noparodhayet /
analyzed: mekhalā bhrama niṣkāsa gavākṣān na uparodhayet
translated: One should not obstruct the balconies, terraces, and windows.

original: praṇālīṃ gṛhavāstuṃ ca pīḍayan daṇḍabhāg bhavet // / / //
analyzed: praṇālīm gṛha vāstum ca pīḍayan daṇḍa bhāj bhavet
translated: Causing obstruction to the gutters and the house site, one would be liable to punishment.

original: niveśasamayād ūrdhvaṃ naite yojyāḥ kathaṃcana /
analyzed: niveśa samayāt ūrdhvam na ete yojyāḥ kathaṃcana
translated: After the time of settlement, these should never be used.

original: gṛhanirmāṇe 'kāryāṇi
analyzed: gṛha nirmāṇe kāryāṇi
translated: Things not to be done in house construction

original: dṛṣṭipātaṃ praṇālīṃ ca na kuryāt paraveśmani // / / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭi pātam praṇālīm ca na kuryāt para veśmani
translated: One should not cast one's eyes or construct gutters on another's house.

original: varcasthānaṃ vahnim ayaṃ gartocchiṣṭāmbusecanam /
analyzed: varca sthānam vahnim ayam garta ucchiṣṭa ambu secanam
translated: The place of excretion, the fire, the pit, sprinkling leftover water,

original: atyārāt parakuḍyasya na kartavyaṃ kadācana // / / //
analyzed: atyārāt para kuḍyasya na kartavyam kadācana
translated: One should never do anything beyond the neighboring wall.

original: viṇmūtrodakavaprāṃś ca vahniśvabhraniveśanam /
analyzed: viṣ mūtra udaka vaprān ca vahni śvabhra niveśanam
translated: And also the discharge of feces, urine, and water, and the construction of a fire pit,

original: aratnidvayam utsṛjya parakuḍyāṃ niveśayet // / / //
analyzed: aratni dvayam utsṛjya para kuḍyām niveśayet
translated: One should build on the neighboring wall, leaving a space of two cubits.

original: yānty āyānti janā yena paśavaś cānivāritāḥ /
analyzed: yānti āyānti janāḥ yena paśavaḥ ca a nivāritāḥ
translated: By which people come and go, and animals are not restrained,

original: tad ucyate saṃsaraṇaṃ na roddhavyaṃ tu kenacit // / / //
analyzed: tat ucyate saṃsaraṇam na roddhavyam tu kenacid
translated: That is called a public road, and it should not be obstructed by anyone.

original: yas tatra saṃkaraṃ śvabhraṃ vṛkṣāropaṇam eva ca /🔽kāmāt purīṣaṃ kuryāc ca tasya daṇḍas tu māṣakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ tatra saṃkaram śvabhram vṛkṣa āropaṇam eva ca  kāmāt purīṣam kuryāt ca tasya daṇḍaḥ tu māṣakaḥ
translated: One who there makes a mixture, a pit, or plants a tree,🔽And intentionally discharges feces, his fine is one māṣa.

original: gṛhītvā vāhayet kāle vāpagopanasaṃgrahān /
analyzed: gṛhītvā vāhayet kāle vāpa gopana saṃgrahān
translated: Having taken, one should make the animal work at the proper time, and should keep and collect the fodder.

original: akurvan svāmine dāpyo madhyaṃ kṛṣṭaśadaṃ tu saḥ // / / //
analyzed: akurvān svāmine dāpyaḥ madhyam kṛṣṭa śadam tu saḥ
translated: Not doing so, he should make good to the owner the middle portion of the plowed field.

original: kṣetraṃ gṛhītvā yaḥ kaścin na kuryān na ca kārayet /
analyzed: kṣetram gṛhītvā yaḥ kaścid na kuryāt na ca kārayet
translated: If someone, having taken a field, neither cultivates it himself nor has it cultivated by others,

original: svāmine sa śadaṃ dāpyo rājñe daṇḍaṃ ca tatsamam // / / //
analyzed: svāmine sa śadam dāpyaḥ rājñe daṇḍam ca tad samam
translated: He should make good to the owner the share of the crop, and to the king a fine equal to it.

original: cirāvasanne daśamaṃ kṛṣyamāṇe tathāṣṭamam /
analyzed: cira avasanne daśamam kṛṣyamāṇe tathā aṣṭamam
translated: If it has been in possession for a long time, the eighth part (of the crop) should be given; if it is being cultivated, the sixth part.

original: susaṃskṛte tu ṣaṣṭhaṃ syāt parikalpya yathāvidhi // / / //
analyzed: susaṃskṛte tu ṣaṣṭham syāt parikalpya yathāvidhi
translated: But if it is well-cultivated, it should be the sixth part, having determined it according to the rules.

original: vākpāruṣyam
analyzed: vāc pāruṣyam
translated: Verbal abuse

original: apriyoktis tāḍanaṃ ca pāruṣyaṃ dvividhaṃ smṛtam /
analyzed: apriya uktiḥ tāḍanam ca pāruṣyam dvividham smṛtam
translated: Harsh speech and beating are known to be the two types of physical violence.

original: ekaikaṃ tu tridhā bhinnaṃ damaś coktas trilakṣaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ekaikam tu tridhā bhinnam damaḥ ca uktaḥ tri lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: But each is divided into three, and punishment is said to have three characteristics.

original: vākpāruṣye traividham
analyzed: vāc pāruṣye traividham
translated: Three types of verbal violence

original: deśadharmakulādīnāṃ kṣepaḥ pāpena yojanam /
analyzed: deśa dharma kula ādīnām kṣepaḥ pāpena yojanam
translated: Ridiculing caste, customs, family, etc., and associating with sinners,

original: dravyaṃ vinā tu prathamaṃ vākpāruṣyaṃ tad ucyate // / / //
analyzed: dravyam vinā tu prathamam vāc pāruṣyam tat ucyate
translated: without property, is said to be the first type of verbal violence.

original: bhaginībhrātṛsaṃbaddham upapātakaśaṃsanam /
analyzed: bhaginī bhrātṛ saṃbaddham upapātaka śaṃsanam
translated: Mentioning the sins of sisters, brothers, and relatives,

original: pāruṣyaṃ madhyamaṃ proktaṃ vācikaṃ śāstravedibhiḥ // / / //🔽abhakṣyāpeyakathanaṃ mahāpātakadūṣaṇam /
analyzed: pāruṣyam madhyamam proktam vācikam śāstra vedibhiḥ  a bhakṣya a peya kathanam mahāpātaka dūṣaṇam
translated: is said by those who know the scriptures to be the middle type of verbal violence.🔽Mentioning inedible and undrinkable things, and defaming great sins,

original: pāruṣyam uttamaṃ proktaṃ tīvram armābhipātanam // / / //
analyzed: pāruṣyam uttamam proktam tīvram arma abhipātanam
translated: is said to be the highest type of violence, severely striking the heart.

original: daṇḍaḥ
analyzed: daṇḍaḥ
translated: Punishment

original: samajātiguṇānāṃ tu vākpāruṣye parasparam /
analyzed: sama jāti guṇānām tu vāc pāruṣye parasparam
translated: For verbal violence among those of the same caste and qualities,

original: vinayo 'bhihitaḥ śāstre paṇas tv ardhatrayodaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vinayaḥ bhihitaḥ śāstre paṇaḥ tu ardha trayodaśaḥ
translated: discipline is prescribed in the scriptures, and the fine is thirteen and a half paṇas.

original: daṇḍaḥ kāṇakhañjādīnāṃ tathāvidhān api kārṣāpaṇadvayam // / / //🔽savarṇākrośane sārdhadvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ /
analyzed: daṇḍaḥ kāṇa khañja ādīnām tathāvidhān api kārṣāpaṇa dvayam  savarṇa ākrośane sārdha dvādaśa paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: The fine for the blind, lame, etc. is also two kārṣāpaṇas.🔽For abusing a person of the same caste, the fine is twelve and a half paṇas.

original: hīnavarṇe kākiṇyadhikaṣaṭpaṇo daṇḍaḥ // / / //
analyzed: hīna varṇe kākiṇī adhika ṣaṣ paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: For abusing a person of a lower caste, the fine is six paṇas and a kākini.

original: kāṇakhañjādīnāṃ tathā
analyzed: kāṇa khañja ādīnām tathā
translated: For the blind, lame, etc.

original: samānayoḥ samo daṇḍo nyūnasya dviguṇas tu saḥ /
analyzed: samānayoḥ samaḥ daṇḍaḥ nyūnasya dviguṇaḥ tu saḥ
translated: The fine for equals is equal, for inferiors it is double,

original: uttamasyādhikaḥ prokto vākpāruṣye parasparam // / / //
analyzed: uttamasya adhikaḥ proktaḥ vāc pāruṣye parasparam
translated: and for superiors it is said to be more, in mutual verbal abuse.

original: kṣipan svasrādikaṃ dadyāt pañcāśatpaṇikaṃ damam /
analyzed: kṣipan svasṛ ādikam dadyāt pañcāśat paṇikam damam
translated: One who insults one's sister and so on should pay a fine of fifty paṇas.

original: guṇahīnasya pāruṣye brāhmaṇo nāparādhnuyāt // / / //
analyzed: guṇa hīnasya pāruṣye brāhmaṇaḥ na aparādhnuyāt
translated: In abusive speech towards one lacking good qualities, a Brahmin should not be punished.

original: patitaṃ patitety uktvā coraṃ coreti vā punaḥ /
analyzed: patitam patita iti uktvā coram cora iti vā punar
translated: Having said fallen to one who is fallen, or thief to one who is a thief,

original: vacanāt tulyadoṣaḥ syāt / / / / / / / / // / / //
analyzed: vacanāt tulya doṣaḥ syāt
translated: one would be equal in fault by the words.

original: varṇabhedena daṇḍabhedaḥ
analyzed: varṇa bhedena daṇḍa bhedaḥ
translated: The difference in punishment based on the difference in castes:

original: dharmopadeśaṃ dharmeṇa viprāṇām asya kurvataḥ /
analyzed: dharma upadeśam dharmeṇa viprāṇām asya kurvataḥ
translated: For this Brahmin who gives religious instruction in accordance with the Dharma,

original: taptam āsiñcayet tailaṃ vaktre śrotre ca pārthivaḥ // / / //
analyzed: taptam āsiñcayet tailam vaktre śrotre ca pārthivaḥ
translated: the king should pour hot oil into his mouth and ears.

original: vipre śatārdhaṃ daṇḍas tu kṣatriyasyābhiśaṃsane /
analyzed: vipre śata ardham daṇḍaḥ tu kṣatriyasya abhiśaṃsane
translated: The fine for slandering a Brahmin is fifty, for a Kshatriya it is a hundred,

original: viśas tathārdhapañcāśac chūdrasyārdhatrayodaśa // / / //
analyzed: viśaḥ tathā ardhapañcāśat śūdrasya ardha trayodaśa
translated: for a Vaishya it is half of that, and for a Shudra it is half of that.

original: sacchūdrasyāyam uddiṣṭo vinayo 'naparādhinaḥ /
analyzed: sat śūdrasya ayam uddiṣṭaḥ vinayaḥ na aparādhinaḥ
translated: This is prescribed as the punishment for an innocent good Shudra.

original: guṇahīnasya pāruṣye brāhmaṇo nāparādhnuyāt // / / //
analyzed: guṇa hīnasya pāruṣye brāhmaṇaḥ na aparādhnuyāt
translated: In abusive speech towards one lacking good qualities, a Brahmin should not be punished.

original: vaiśyasya kṣatriyākrośe daṇḍanīyaḥ prado bhavet /
analyzed: vaiśyasya kṣatriya ākrośe daṇḍanīyaḥ pradaḥ bhavet
translated: For a Vaishya insulting a Kshatriya, the fine should be one-fourth.

original: tadardhaṃ kṣatriyo vaiśyaṃ kṣipan vinayam arhati // / / //
analyzed: tad ardham kṣatriyaḥ vaiśyam kṣipan vinayam arhati
translated: A Kshatriya who abuses a Vaishya deserves half of that fine.

original: śūdrākrośe kṣatriyasya pañcaviṃśatiko damaḥ /
analyzed: śūdrā krośe kṣatriyasya pañcaviṃśatikaḥ damaḥ
translated: For abusing a Shudra, a Kshatriya should be fined twenty-five panas.

original: bṛhatve dviguṇaṃ tatra śāstravidbhir udāhṛtam // / / //
analyzed: bṛhat tve dviguṇam tatra śāstra vidbhiḥ udāhṛtam
translated: In the case of a Brahmana, twice that fine is prescribed by those who know the scriptures.

original: vaiśyam ākṣārayañ śūdro dāpyaḥ syāt prathamaṃ damam /
analyzed: vaiśyam ākṣārayam śūdraḥ dāpyaḥ syāt prathamam damam
translated: A Shudra who abuses a Vaishya should be fined the first amercement.

original: kṣatriyaṃ madhyamaṃ caiva vipram uttamasāhasam // / / //
analyzed: kṣatriyam madhyamam ca eva vipram uttama sāhasam
translated: For abusing a Kshatriya, the middlemost amercement, and for abusing a Brahmana, the highest amercement.

original: deśādikaṃ kṣipan dāpyaḥ paṇān ardhatrayodaśa /
analyzed: deśa ādikam kṣipan dāpyaḥ paṇān ardha trayodaśa
translated: One who abuses a person by mentioning his country, etc. should be fined thirteen and a half panas.

original: pāpena yojayan darpād dāpyaḥ prathamasāhasam // / / //
analyzed: pāpena yojayan darpāt dāpyaḥ prathama sāhasam
translated: One who falsely imputes a crime out of contempt should be fined the first amercement.

original: dharmopadeśakartā ca vedodāharaṇānvitaḥ /
analyzed: dharma upadeśa kartā ca veda udāharaṇa anvitaḥ
translated: One who gives religious instruction, citing the Vedas,

original: ākrośakas tu viprāṇāṃ jihvāc chedena daṇḍyate // / / //
analyzed: ākrośakaḥ tu viprāṇām jihvāt chedena daṇḍyate
translated: should be punished by cutting off the tongue for abusing Brahmins.

original: eṣa daṇḍaḥ samākhyātaḥ puruṣāpekṣayā mayā /
analyzed: eṣa daṇḍaḥ samākhyātaḥ puruṣa apekṣayā mayā
translated: This is the punishment I have prescribed, taking into account the status of the person.

original: samanyūnādhikatvena kalpanīyo manīṣibhiḥ // / / //🔽daṇḍapāruṣyam
analyzed: sama nyūna adhika tvena kalpanīyaḥ manīṣibhiḥ  daṇḍa pāruṣyam
translated: The wise should determine it according to the gravity of the offense, whether it is less, equal, or more.🔽Physical Assault

original: hastapāṣāṇalaguḍair bhasmakardamapāṃsubhiḥ /
analyzed: hasta pāṣāṇa laguḍaiḥ bhasma kardama pāṃsubhiḥ
translated: Striking with hands, stones, sticks, ashes, mud, dust,

original: āyudhaiś ca praharaṇair daṇḍapāruṣyam ucyate // / / //
analyzed: āyudhaiḥ ca praharaṇaiḥ daṇḍa pāruṣyam ucyate
translated: weapons, and other instruments is called physical assault.

original: vākpāruṣye kṛte yasya yathā daṇḍo vidhīyate /
analyzed: vāc pāruṣye kṛte yasya yathā daṇḍaḥ vidhīyate
translated: The punishment for verbal assault is prescribed as follows:

original: tasyaiva dviguṇaṃ daṇḍaṃ kārayen maraṇād ṛte // / / //
analyzed: tasya eva dviguṇam daṇḍam kārayet maraṇāt ṛte
translated: For the same, the king should impose a fine twice the amount, except in case of death.

original: dvayoḥ praharator daṇḍaḥ samayos tu samaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: dvayoḥ praharatoḥ daṇḍaḥ samayoḥ tu samaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: When two people strike each other, the fine is considered equal.

original: ārambhako 'nubandhī ca dāpyaḥ syād adhikaṃ damam // / / //
analyzed: ārambhakaḥ nubandhī ca dāpyaḥ syāt adhikam damam
translated: The one who initiates the fight and the one who continues it should be made to pay an additional fine.

original: pūrvākruṣṭaḥ samākrośaṃs tāḍitaḥ pratitāḍayan /
analyzed: pūrva ākruṣṭaḥ samākrośan tāḍitaḥ pratitāḍayan
translated: One who retorts when abused, strikes back when beaten,

original: hatvātatāyinaṃ caiva nāparādhī bhaven naraḥ // / / //
analyzed: hatvā ātatāyinam ca eva na aparādhī bhavet naraḥ
translated: or kills an assailant is not guilty.

original: vākpāruṣyādinā nīco yaḥ santam abhilaṅghayet /
analyzed: vāc pāruṣya ādinā nīcaḥ yaḥ santam abhilaṅghayet
translated: If an inferior person insults a good man with harsh words, etc.,

original: sa eva tāḍayaṃs tasya nānveṣṭavyo mahībhujā // / / //
analyzed: saḥ eva tāḍayan tasya na anveṣṭavyaḥ mahībhujā
translated: the king should not investigate if he strikes back.

original: prathamaṃ daṇḍapāruṣyam
analyzed: prathamam daṇḍa pāruṣyam
translated: First, assault with a weapon

original: bhasmādīnāṃ prakṣipaṇaṃ tāḍanaṃ ca karādinā /
analyzed: bhasma ādīnām prakṣipaṇam tāḍanam ca kara ādinā
translated: Throwing ashes, etc., and beating with the hand, etc.,

original: prathamaṃ daṇḍapāruṣyaṃ damaḥ kāryo 'tra māṣikaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prathamam daṇḍa pāruṣyam damaḥ kāryaḥ māṣikaḥ
translated: is the first assault, and the fine should be one māṣa.

original: eṣa daṇḍaḥ sameṣūktaḥ parastrīṣv adhikeṣu ca /
analyzed: eṣa daṇḍaḥ sameṣu uktaḥ para strīṣu adhikeṣu ca
translated: This fine is prescribed for equal parties in the case of other men's wives and superiors.

original: dviguṇas triguṇo jñeyaḥ prādhānyāpekṣayā buddhaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: dviguṇaḥ triguṇaḥ jñeyaḥ prādhānya apekṣayā buddhaiḥ
translated: The wise should know it to be double or triple depending on the importance of the parties.

original: udyate 'śmaśilākāṣṭhe kartavyaḥ prathamo damaḥ /
analyzed: udyate śma śilā kāṣṭhe kartavyaḥ prathamaḥ damaḥ
translated: When a stone, a clod, or a stick is raised, the first fine should be imposed.

original: parasparaṃ hastapāde daśaviṃśatikas tathā // / / //
analyzed: parasparam hasta pāde daśa viṃśatikaḥ tathā
translated: When there is mutual striking with the hand or foot, it is ten or twenty paṇas.

original: madhyamam
analyzed: madhyamam
translated: Medium

original: madhyamaḥ śastrasaṃdhāne saṃyojyaḥ kṣubdhayor dvayoḥ /
analyzed: madhyamaḥ śastra saṃdhāne saṃyojyaḥ kṣubdhayoḥ dvayoḥ
translated: The middlemost fine should be imposed for joining two quarrelling persons with weapons.

original: kāryaḥ kṛtānurūpas tu lagne ghāte damo budhaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāryaḥ kṛta anurūpaḥ tu lagne ghāte damaḥ budhaiḥ
translated: The fine for killing in a nativity should be imposed by the wise in accordance with the deed.

original: iṣṭakopalakāṣṭhaiś ca tāḍane tu dvimāṣikaḥ /
analyzed: iṣṭakā upala kāṣṭhaiḥ ca tāḍane tu dvi māṣikaḥ
translated: For beating with bricks, stones, or wood, the fine is two māṣas.

original: dviguṇaḥ śoṇitodbhede daṇḍaḥ kāryo manīṣibhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: dviguṇaḥ śoṇita udbhede daṇḍaḥ kāryaḥ manīṣibhiḥ
translated: The wise should impose a fine of twice that amount for causing blood to flow.

original: tvagbhede prathamo daṇḍo māṃsabhede tu madhyamaḥ /
analyzed: tvak bhede prathamaḥ daṇḍaḥ māṃsa bhede tu madhyamaḥ
translated: For breaking the skin, the first fine, for breaking the flesh, the middlemost,

original: uttamam
analyzed: uttamam
translated: The highest

original: uttamas tv asthibhede syād dhātena tu pramāpaṇam // / / //
analyzed: uttamaḥ tu asthibhede syāt dhātena tu pramāpaṇam
translated: is for breaking the bones. For killing, the highest fine should be imposed.

original: karṇanāsākaracchede dantabhaṅge 'sthibhedane /
analyzed: karṇa nāsā kara chede danta bhaṅge sthi bhedane
translated: For cutting off the ears, nose, lips, feet, eyes, tongue, penis, or hands,

original: kartavyo madhyamo daṇḍo dviguṇaḥ patiteṣu tu // / / //
analyzed: kartavyaḥ madhyamaḥ daṇḍaḥ dviguṇaḥ patiteṣu tu
translated: the middlemost fine should be imposed, but double that for outcasts.

original: karṇauṣṭhaghrāṇapādākṣi jihvāśiśnakarasya ca /🔽chedane cottamo daṇḍo bhedane madhyamo guruḥ // / / //
analyzed: karṇa oṣṭha ghrāṇa pāda akṣi jihvā śiśna karasya ca  chedane ca uttamaḥ daṇḍaḥ bhedane madhyamaḥ guruḥ
translated: For cutting off the ears, lips, nose, feet, eyes, tongue, penis, or hands,🔽the highest fine should be imposed, and the middlemost heavy fine for breaking them.

original: daṇḍas tv abhihitāyaiva daṇḍapāruṣyakalpitaḥ /
analyzed: daṇḍaḥ tu abhihitāya eva daṇḍa pāruṣya kalpitaḥ
translated: The fine is prescribed only for the one who is accused of assault.

original: hṛte tad dviguṇaṃ cānyad rājadaṇḍas tato 'dhikaḥ // / / //
analyzed: hṛte tat dviguṇam ca anyat rāja daṇḍaḥ tatas dhikaḥ
translated: For stealing, twice that amount should be given, and the king's fine is more than that.

original: aṅgāvabhedane caiva pīḍane chedane tathā /
analyzed: aṅga avabhedane ca eva pīḍane chedane tathā
translated: For breaking the limbs, causing pain, or cutting them,

original: samutthānavyayaṃ dāpyaḥ kalahāpahṛtaṃ ca yat // / / //
analyzed: samutthāna vyayam dāpyaḥ kalaha apahṛtam ca yat
translated: He should be made to pay the expenses incurred in the fight, as well as what was taken away by the disputants.

original: vivikte tāḍito yas tu hato dṛśyeta vā bhavet /
analyzed: vivikte tāḍitaḥ yaḥ tu hataḥ dṛśyeta vā bhavet
translated: If someone is beaten or found dead in a secluded place,

original: hantā tad anumānena vijñeyaḥ śapathena vā // / / //
analyzed: hantā tat anumānena vijñeyaḥ śapathena vā
translated: the assailant should be known through inference or by an oath.

original: antarveśmany araṇye vā niśāyāṃ yatra tāḍitaḥ /
analyzed: antarveśmani araṇye vā niśāyām yatra tāḍitaḥ
translated: If someone is beaten or blood is seen in a house or forest at night,

original: śoṇitaṃ tatra dṛśyeta na pṛcchet tatra sākṣiṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śoṇitam tatra dṛśyeta na pṛcchet tatra sākṣiṇaḥ
translated: witnesses should not be questioned in that case.

original: kaścit kṛtvātmanaś cihnaṃ dveṣāt param abhidravet /
analyzed: kaścid kṛtvā ātmanaḥ cihnam dveṣāt param abhidravet
translated: If someone, out of hatred, attacks another after marking himself,

original: hetvartham atisāmarthyais tatra yuktaṃ parīkṣaṇam // / / //🔽ākruṣṭas tu samākrośaṃs tāḍitaḥ pratitāḍayan /
analyzed: hetu artham ati sāmarthyaiḥ tatra yuktam parīkṣaṇam  ākruṣṭaḥ tu samākrośan tāḍitaḥ pratitāḍayan
translated: then an investigation is proper there for the sake of the reason and the ability.🔽But a man who curses back when cursed, strikes back when struck,

original: hatvāparādhinaṃ caiva nāparādhī bhaven naraḥ // / / //
analyzed: hatvā aparādhinam ca eva na aparādhī bhavet naraḥ
translated: and kills an offender, is not guilty.

original: prātilomyās tathā cāntyāḥ puruṣāṇāṃ malāḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: prātilomyāḥ tathā ca antyāḥ puruṣāṇām malāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: Similarly, those of the reverse order and the lowest castes are considered the impurities of men.

original: brāhmaṇātikrame vadhyā na dātavyā dhanaṃ kvacit // / / //
analyzed: brāhmaṇa atikrame vadhyāḥ na dātavyāḥ dhanam kvacid
translated: If they transgress a Brahmin, they should be killed and no fine should be imposed.

original: śrāntān kṣudhārtān tṛṣitān akāle vāhayet tu yaḥ /
analyzed: śrāntān kṣudhā ārtān tṛṣitān akāle vāhayet tu yaḥ
translated: If someone makes tired, hungry, and thirsty animals draw at the wrong time,

original: sa goghno niṣkṛtiṃ kāryo dāpyo vāpy athavā damam // / / //
analyzed: sa go ghnaḥ niṣkṛtim kāryaḥ dāpyaḥ vā api athavā damam
translated: he should be made to atone for killing cows or fined.

original: samutthānavyayaṃ dāpyaḥ kalahāya kṛtaṃ ca yat /
analyzed: samutthāna vyayam dāpyaḥ kalahāya kṛtam ca yat
translated: He who has caused a quarrel should be made to pay the expenses incurred in the investigation.

original: yenāṅgena dvijātīnāṃ śūdraḥ praharate ruṣā /
analyzed: yena aṅgena dvijātīnām śūdraḥ praharate ruṣā
translated: By whatever limb a Shudra strikes a twice-born person in anger,

original: chettavyaṃ tad bhavet tasya manunā samudāhṛtam // / / //
analyzed: chettavyam tat bhavet tasya manunā samudāhṛtam
translated: that very limb of his shall be cut off, so has Manu declared.

original: steyam
analyzed: steyam
translated: Stealing

original: prakāśāś cāprakāśāś ca taskarā dvividhā smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: prakāśāḥ ca aprakāśāḥ ca taskarāḥ dvividhā smṛtāḥ
translated: Thieves are said to be of two kinds, those who steal openly and those who steal secretly.

original: prajñāsāmarthyam āyābhiḥ prabhinnās te sahasradhā // / / //🔽prakāśāprakāśataskarāḥ🔽naigamā vaidyakitavāḥ sabhyotkocakavañcakāḥ /
analyzed: prajñā sāmarthyam āyābhiḥ prabhinnāḥ te sahasradhā  prakāśa aprakāśa taskarāḥ  naigamāḥ vaidya kitavāḥ sabhya utkocaka vañcakāḥ
translated: They are divided into a thousand types by the strength of their intelligence and means.🔽Open and secret thieves🔽Merchants, physicians, court officials, extortionists, cheats,

original: daivotpātavido bhadrāḥ śilpajñāḥ pratirūpakāḥ // / / //
analyzed: daiva utpāta vidaḥ bhadrāḥ śilpa jñāḥ pratirūpakāḥ
translated: Astrologers, fortune-tellers, craftsmen, actors,

original: akriyākāriṇaś caiva madhyasthāḥ kūṭasākṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: akriyā kāriṇaḥ ca eva madhyasthāḥ kūṭa sākṣiṇaḥ
translated: Those who do not perform their duties, neutrals, perjurers,

original: prakāśataskarā hy ete tathā kuhakajīvinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prakāśa taskarāḥ hi ete tathā kuhaka jīvinaḥ
translated: These are open thieves, as well as those who live by deception.

original: sandhicchidaḥ pānthamuṣo dvicatuṣpadahāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: sandhi chidaḥ pāntha muṣaḥ dvi catuṣpada hāriṇaḥ
translated: Those who break into houses, rob travelers, steal two or four-legged animals,

original: utkṣepakāḥ sasyaharāḥ jñeyāḥ pracchannataskarāḥ // / / //
analyzed: utkṣepakāḥ sasya harāḥ jñeyāḥ pracchanna taskarāḥ
translated: Those who throw up barricades, steal crops, should be known as secret thieves.

original: teṣāṃ daṇḍaḥ
analyzed: teṣām daṇḍaḥ
translated: Their punishment

original: saṃsargacihnarūpaiś ca vijñātā rājapūruṣaiḥ /
analyzed: saṃsarga cihna rūpaiḥ ca vijñātā rāja pūruṣaiḥ
translated: By the king's officers who know them by their association, marks, and other signs,

original: pradāpyāpahṛtaṃ daṇḍyā damaiḥ śāstrapracoditaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: pradāpya apahṛtam daṇḍyāḥ damaiḥ śāstra pracoditaiḥ
translated: The stolen property should be restored to them, and they should be fined the punishments prescribed by the scriptures.

original: utkṣepakas tu saṃdaṃśair bhettavyo rājapūruṣaiḥ /
analyzed: utkṣepakaḥ tu saṃdaṃśaiḥ bhettavyaḥ rāja pūruṣaiḥ
translated: But the one who steals by lifting should be torn apart by the king's men with pincers.

original: dhānyahartā daśaguṇaṃ dāpyaḥ syād dviguṇaṃ damam // / / //
analyzed: dhānya hartā daśaguṇam dāpyaḥ syāt dviguṇam damam
translated: The one who steals grain should be made to pay ten times the value and a fine of twice that amount.

original: ekasmin yatra nidhanaṃ prāpite duṣṭacāriṇi /
analyzed: ekasmin yatra nidhanam prāpite duṣṭa cāriṇi
translated: When a single one of evil conduct is brought to death,

original: bahūnāṃ bhavati kṣemaḥ tasya puṇyaprado vadhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bahūnām bhavati kṣemaḥ tasya puṇya pradaḥ vadhaḥ
translated: if it brings peace to many, the killing of that one is meritorious.

original: tathā pāntham uṣo vṛkṣe gale badhvāvalambayet // / / //
analyzed: tathā pāntham uṣaḥ vṛkṣe gale badhvā avalambayet
translated: Similarly, a traveler who has stolen should be hung by the neck from a tree at dawn.

original: aṅgulīgranthibhedasya chedayet prathame grahe /
analyzed: aṅgulī granthibhedasya chedayet prathame grahe
translated: For one who breaks the finger joints, in the first offense his fingers should be cut off.

original: dvitīye hastacaraṇau tṛtīye vadham arhati // / / //
analyzed: dvitīye hasta caraṇau tṛtīye vadham arhati
translated: In the second offense, his hands and feet, and in the third he deserves death.

original: ajñātauṣadhimantras tu yaś ca vyādher atattvavit /
analyzed: a jñāta oṣadhi mantraḥ tu yaḥ ca vyādheḥ a tattva vid
translated: A physician who does not know the medicines and mantras, and who is ignorant of the nature of diseases,

original: rogibhyo 'rthaṃ samādatte sa daṇḍyaś coravad bhiṣak // / / //
analyzed: rogibhyaḥ ṛtham samādatte sa daṇḍyaḥ cora vat bhiṣak
translated: and who takes money from the sick, should be punished like a thief.

original: glahaḥ prakāśaḥ kartavyo nirvāsyāḥ kūṭadevinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: glahaḥ prakāśaḥ kartavyaḥ nirvāsyāḥ kūṭa devinaḥ
translated: The gambling should be done openly, and those who cheat should be expelled.

original: kūṭākṣadevinaḥ kṣudrā rājabhāryāharāś ca ye /
analyzed: kūṭa akṣa devinaḥ kṣudrāḥ rāja bhāryā harāḥ ca ye
translated: Those who cheat at dice, the low ones who rape the king's wives,

original: gaṇakā vañcakāś caiva daṇḍyās te kitavā smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: gaṇakāḥ vañcakāḥ ca eva daṇḍyāḥ te kitavāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: the accountants and deceivers, are considered gamblers and should be punished.

original: pracchannadoṣavyāmiśraṃ punaḥ saṃskṛtavikrayī /
analyzed: pracchanna doṣa vyāmiśram punar saṃskṛta vikrayī
translated: One who sells adulterated or reconditioned goods with hidden defects,

original: paṇye tad dviguṇaṃ dāpyo vaṇigdaṇḍaṃ ca tatsamam // / / //
analyzed: paṇye tat dviguṇam dāpyaḥ vaṇij daṇḍam ca tad samam
translated: In the case of merchandise, he should be made to pay double the amount, and the merchant should be fined an equal amount.

original: anyāyavādinaḥ sabhyās tathaivotkocajīvinaḥ /
analyzed: anyāya vādinaḥ sabhyāḥ tathā evā utkoca jīvinaḥ
translated: The members of the assembly who speak unjustly, as well as those who live by extortion,

original: viśvastavañcakāś caiva nirvāsyāḥ sarva eva te // / / //
analyzed: viśvasta vañcakāḥ ca eva nirvāsyāḥ sarve eva te
translated: and those who deceive those who trust them, all of them should be banished.

original: jyotir jñānaṃ tathotpātam aviditvā tu ye nṛṇām /
analyzed: jyotiḥ jñānam tathā utpātam a viditvā tu ye nṛṇām
translated: Those who proclaim to people the knowledge of astrology and portents without knowing them,

original: śrāvayanty arthalobhena vineyās te prayatnataḥ // / / //
analyzed: śrāvayanti artha lobhena vineyāḥ te prayatnataḥ
translated: out of greed for wealth, they should be carefully punished.

original: daṇḍājinādibhir yuktam ātmānaṃ darśayanti ye /
analyzed: daṇḍa ajina ādibhiḥ yuktam ātmānam darśayanti ye
translated: Those who show themselves as having the staff, the deerskin, and so on,

original: hiṃsantaś cchadmanā nṛṇāṃ vadhyās te rājapūruṣaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: hiṃsantaḥ chadmanā nṛṇām vadhyāḥ te rāja pūruṣaiḥ
translated: and who harm people by deceit, they should be killed by the king's men.

original: alpamūlyaṃ tu saṃskṛtya nayanti bahumūlyatām /
analyzed: alpa mūlyam tu saṃskṛtya nayanti bahu mūlya tām
translated: Those who, after slightly increasing the value, sell gold, pearls, coral, and so on as if they were of great value,

original: strībālakān vañcayanti daṇḍyās te 'rthānurūpataḥ // / / //
analyzed: strī bālakān vañcayanti daṇḍyāḥ te ṛtha anurūpataḥ
translated: depriving women and children, they should be fined according to the amount involved.

original: hemamuktāprabālādyaṃ kṛtrimaṃ kurvate tu ye /
analyzed: hema muktā prabāla ādyam kṛtrimam kurvate tu ye
translated: Those who make artificial gold, pearls, coral, and so on,

original: kretre mūlyaṃ pradāpyās te rājñā tad dviguṇaṃ damam // / / //
analyzed: kretre mūlyam pradāpyāḥ te rājñā tat dviguṇam damam
translated: they should be made to pay the price to the buyer, and a fine of twice that amount by the king.

original: madhyasthā vañcayanty ekaṃ snehalobhādinā yadā /
analyzed: madhyasthāḥ vañcayanti ekam sneha lobha ādinā yadā
translated: When the neutral party deceives one side out of affection, greed, and so on,

original: sākṣiṇaś cānyathā brūyur dāpyās te dviguṇaṃ damam // / / //
analyzed: sākṣiṇaḥ ca anyathā brūyuḥ dāpyāḥ te dviguṇam damam
translated: and the witnesses speak otherwise, they should be fined twice the amount.

original: mantrauṣadhibalāt kiṃcit saṃbhrāntiṃ darśayanti ye /
analyzed: mantra oṣadhi balāt kiṃcid saṃbhrāntim darśayanti ye
translated: Those who, by the power of mantras and herbs, show some confusion,

original: mūlakarma ca kurvanti nirvāsyās te mahībhujā // / / //
analyzed: mūlakarma ca kurvanti nirvāsyāḥ te mahībhujā
translated: and perform root-acts, should be expelled by the king.

original: sandhicchedo hṛtaṃ tyājyāḥ śūlam āropayet tataḥ /
analyzed: sandhi chedaḥ hṛtam tyājyāḥ śūlam āropayet tatas
translated: One who breaks a treaty should be abandoned, and then impaled.

original: tathā pāntham uṣo vṛkṣe gale baddhvāvalambayet // / / //
analyzed: tathā pāntham uṣaḥ vṛkṣe gale baddhvā avalambayet
translated: Similarly, a traveler should be bound by the neck to a tree at dawn and left hanging.

original: manuṣyahāriṇo rājñā dagdhavyās te kaṭāgninā /🔽gohartur nāsikāṃ chindyāt badhvā vāmbhasi majjayet // / / //
analyzed: manuṣya hāriṇaḥ rājñā dagdhavyāḥ te kaṭāgninā  go hartuḥ nāsikām chindyāt badhvā vā ambhasi majjayet
translated: Those who abduct humans should be burned by the king in a fire of straw.🔽The nose of one who steals cows should be cut off, or he should be bound and drowned in water.

original: dhānyaṃ daśabhyaḥ kumbhebhyo haraṇe 'bhyadhikaṃ vadhaḥ /
analyzed: dhānyam daśabhyaḥ kumbhebhyaḥ haraṇe bhyadhikam vadhaḥ
translated: For stealing more than ten jars of grain, the death penalty should be imposed.

original: śeṣeṣv ekādaśaguṇaṃ dāpyas tasya ca taddhanam // / / //
analyzed: śeṣeṣu ekādaśa guṇam dāpyaḥ tasya ca tat dhanam
translated: In the remaining cases, he should be made to pay eleven times the value of the grain, and his wealth should be confiscated.

original: dhānyahārī daśaguṇaṃ dāpyas tad dviguṇaṃ damam // / / //
analyzed: dhānya hārī daśaguṇam dāpyaḥ tad dviguṇam damam
translated: One who steals grain should be made to pay ten times its value, and a fine of twice that amount.

original: tṛṇaṃ vā yadi vā kāṣṭhaṃ puṣpaṃ vā yadi vā phalam /
analyzed: tṛṇam vā yadi vā kāṣṭham puṣpam vā yadi vā phalam
translated: Grass, wood, flowers, or fruits,

original: anāpṛcchya tu gṛhṇāno hastacchedanam arhati // / / //
analyzed: an āpṛcchya tu gṛhṇānaḥ hasta chedanam arhati
translated: if taken without permission, he deserves to have his hand cut off.

original: vṛttasvādhyāyavān steyī bandhane kleśyate ciram /
analyzed: vṛtta svādhyāyavān steyī bandhane kleśyate ciram
translated: One who steals while studying the Vedas is tormented for a long time in bondage.

original: svāmine tad dhanaṃ dāpyaḥ prāyaścittaṃ na kāryate // / / //🔽sāhasam
analyzed: svāmine tat dhanam dāpyaḥ prāyaścittam na kāryate  sāhasam
translated: He should be made to pay that wealth to the owner, and no penance is required.🔽Violence

original: sāhasam
analyzed: sāhasam
translated: Violence

original: stenānām etad ākhyātaṃ sarveṣāṃ daṇḍanigraham /
analyzed: stenānām etat ākhyātam sarveṣām daṇḍa nigraham
translated: This has been declared to be the punishment for all thieves.

original: sāhasasyādhunā samyak śrūyatāṃ vadhaśāsanam // / / //
analyzed: sāhasasya adhunā samyak śrūyatām vadha śāsanam
translated: Now listen properly to the punishment for violence, the punishment for murder.

original: manuṣyamāraṇaṃ cauryaṃ paradārābhimarśanam /
analyzed: manuṣya māraṇam cauryam para dāra abhimarśanam
translated: Murder of a human being, theft, molesting another's wife,

original: pāruṣyam ubhayaṃ caiva sāhasaṃ tu caturvidham // / / //
analyzed: pāruṣyam ubhayam ca eva sāhasam tu caturvidham
translated: and both kinds of assault - these are the four types of violence.

original: hīnamadhyottamatvena trividhaṃ tat prakīrtitam /
analyzed: hīna madhya uttama tvena trividham tat prakīrtitam
translated: It is declared to be of three kinds - low, middling, and high - according to the object.

original: dravyāpekṣayā damās tatra prathamottamamadhyamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: dravya apekṣayā damāḥ tatra prathama uttama madhyamāḥ
translated: The punishments for them are the lowest, highest, and middling, depending on the object.

original: ātatāyidvijāgyāṇāṃ dharmayuddhena hiṃsanam /
analyzed: ātatāyi dvijāgyāṇām dharma yuddhena hiṃsanam
translated: The killing of an assailant, a Brahmin, or a woman in a righteous battle,

original: imān dharmān kaliyuge varjyān āhur manīṣiṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: imān dharmān kali yuge varjyān āhuḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: These are the duties that the wise declare to be avoidable in the Kali age.

original: kṣetropakaraṇaṃ setuṃ mūlapuṣpaphalāni ca /
analyzed: kṣetra upakaraṇam setum mūla puṣpa phalāni ca
translated: One who destroys or steals the implements of a field, a dam, roots, flowers, or fruits,

original: vināśayan haran daṇḍyaḥ śatodyam anurūpataḥ // / / //🔽paśuvastrānnapānāni gṛhopakaraṇaṃ tathā /
analyzed: vināśayan haran daṇḍyaḥ śatodyam anurūpatas  paśu vastra anna pānāni gṛha upakaraṇam tathā
translated: should be fined one hundred paṇas according to the value of the object.🔽One who injures or steals cattle, clothes, food, drink, or household implements,

original: hiṃsayaṃś cauravad dāpyo dviśatodyaṃ damaṃ tathā // / / //
analyzed: hiṃsayan caura vat dāpyaḥ dvi śata udyam damam tathā
translated: should be made to pay a fine of two hundred paṇas, like a thief.

original: strīpuṃsau hemaratnāni devavipradhanaṃ tathā /
analyzed: strīpuṃsau hema ratnāni deva vipra dhanam tathā
translated: A man and a woman, gold, jewels, the wealth of gods and Brahmins,

original: kauśeyaṃ cottamadravyam eṣāṃ mūlyasamo damaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kauśeyam ca uttama dravyam eṣām mūlya samaḥ damaḥ
translated: and fine silk - the fine is equal to the value of these.

original: dviguṇo vā kalpanīyaḥ puruṣāpekṣayā nṛpaiḥ /
analyzed: dviguṇaḥ vā kalpanīyaḥ puruṣa apekṣayā nṛpaiḥ
translated: Or twice that, depending on the man, should be fixed by the kings.

original: hantā vā ghātanīyaḥ syāt prasaṃgavinivṛttaye // / / //
analyzed: hantā vā ghātanīyaḥ syāt prasaṃga vinivṛttaye
translated: Or the killer should be killed to prevent the spread of the contagion.

original: sāhasaṃ pañcadhā proktaṃ vadhas tatrādhikaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: sāhasam pañcadhā proktam vadhaḥ tatra adhikaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Violence is said to be of five kinds, and killing is considered the most serious among them.

original: tatkāriṇo nārthadamaiḥ śāsyā vadhyāḥ prayatnataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tad kāriṇaḥ na artha damaiḥ śāsyāḥ vadhyāḥ prayatnataḥ
translated: Those who commit it should be punished with fines, not killed, with great effort.

original: prakāśaghātakā ye tu tathā copāṃśughātakāḥ /
analyzed: prakāśa ghātakāḥ ye tu tathā ca upāṃśu ghātakāḥ
translated: Those who kill openly, and those who kill secretly,

original: jñātvā samyagdhanaṃ hṛtvā hantavyāḥ vividhair vadhaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: jñātvā samyak dhanam hṛtvā hantavyāḥ vividhaiḥ vadhaiḥ
translated: having ascertained them properly, should have their wealth confiscated and be killed by various means of execution.

original: sāhasikāḥ daṇḍyāḥ
analyzed: sāhasikāḥ daṇḍyāḥ
translated: Those who commit violence should be punished.

original: mitraprāptyarthalābhe vā rājñā lokahitaiṣiṇā /
analyzed: mitra prāpti artha lābhe vā rājñā loka hita eṣiṇā
translated: For the sake of acquiring friends and wealth, or for the welfare of the people,

original: na moktavyāḥ sāhasikāḥ sarvalokabhayāvahāḥ // / / //
analyzed: na moktavyāḥ sāhasikāḥ sarva loka bhaya āvahāḥ
translated: those who commit violence, who are terrifying to all people, should not be released.

original: lobhād bhayād vā yo rājā na hanty anyāyakāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: lobhāt bhayāt vā yaḥ rājā na hanti anyāya kāriṇaḥ
translated: If a king, out of greed or fear, does not kill those who act unjustly,

original: tasya prakṣubhyate rāṣṭraṃ rājyāc ca parihīyate // / / //🔽bandhāgniviṣaśastreṇa parān yas tu pramāpayet /
analyzed: tasya prakṣubhyate rāṣṭram rājyāt ca parihīyate  bandha agni viṣa śastreṇa parān yaḥ tu pramāpayet
translated: his kingdom becomes agitated and he loses his kingdom.🔽If a man kills others by means of bondage, fire, poison, or weapons,

original: krodhādinā nimittena naraḥ sāhasikas tu saḥ // / / //
analyzed: krodha ādinā nimittena naraḥ sāhasikaḥ tu saḥ
translated: out of anger or some other motive, he is a violent man.

original: saṃbhūyapraharaṇanirṇayaḥ
analyzed: saṃbhūya praharaṇa nirṇayaḥ
translated: Determination of collective assault

original: ekasya bahavo yatra praharanti ruṣānvitāḥ /
analyzed: ekasya bahavaḥ yatra praharanti ruṣā anvitāḥ
translated: Where many people collectively strike one person out of anger,

original: marmaprahārado yas tu ghātakaḥ sa udāhṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: marma prahāra daḥ yaḥ tu ghātakaḥ saḥ udāhṛtaḥ
translated: One who strikes at the vital parts is said to be a killer.

original: marmaghātī tu yas teṣāṃ yathoktaṃ dāpayed damam /
analyzed: marma ghātī tu yaḥ teṣām yathā uktam dāpayet damam
translated: But one who strikes at the vital parts of those should be made to pay the fine as stated.

original: ārambhakṛtsahāyaś ca tathā mārgānudeśakaḥ /
analyzed: ārambha kṛt sahāyaḥ ca tathā mārga anudeśakaḥ
translated: The one who initiates the action, the accomplice, the one who directs the path,

original: āśrayaḥ śastradātā ca bhaktadātā vikarmiṇām // / / //
analyzed: āśrayaḥ śastra dātā ca bhakta dātā vikarmiṇām
translated: The one who provides shelter, the one who gives weapons, the one who gives food to criminals,

original: yuddhopadeśakaś caiva tadvināśapradarśakaḥ /🔽upekṣī kāryayuktaś ca doṣavaktānumodakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yuddha upadeśakaḥ ca eva tad vināśa pradarśakaḥ  upekṣī kārya yuktaḥ ca doṣa vaktā anumodakaḥ
translated: The one who teaches warfare, the one who displays the destruction,

original: ātatāyivadhaḥ
analyzed: ātatāyi vadhaḥ
translated: The one who is indifferent, the one who is engaged in other work, the one who speaks of faults, the one who approves,🔽Killing an assailant

original: nātatāyivadhe hantā kilviṣaṃ prāpnuyāt kvacit /
analyzed: na ātatāyi vadhe hantā kilviṣam prāpnuyāt kvacid
translated: The killer does not incur sin anywhere in killing an assailant.

original: vināśārthinam āyāntaṃ ghātayann āparādhnuyāt // / / //🔽ātatāyinam utkṛṣṭaṃ vṛttasvādhyāyasaṃyutam /
analyzed: vināśa arthinam āyāntam ghātayan āparādhnuyāt  ātatāyinam utkṛṣṭam vṛtta svādhyāya saṃyutam
translated: By killing one who is coming to destroy him, he would incur a sin.🔽One who does not kill an excellent assailant endowed with good conduct, self-study, and restraint,

original: yo na hanyād vadhaprāptaṃ so 'śvamedhaphalaṃ labhet // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ na hanyāt vadha prāptam saḥ śvamedha phalam labhet
translated: And who deserves to be killed, would obtain the fruit of a horse sacrifice.

original: svādhyāyinaṃ kule jātaṃ yo hanyād ātatāyinam /
analyzed: svādhyāyinam kule jātam yaḥ hanyāt ātatāyinam
translated: One who kills an assailant who is a self-study, born in a good family,

original: ahatvā bhrūṇahā sa syān na hatvā bhrūṇahā bhavet // / / //
analyzed: a hatvā bhrūṇa hā sa syāt na hatvā bhrūṇa hā bhavet
translated: By not killing him, he would become a killer of a fetus, but by killing him, he would not become a killer of a fetus.

original: sāṃprataṃ sāhasaṃ steyaṃ śrūyatāṃ krodhalobhajam /
analyzed: sāṃpratam sāhasam steyam śrūyatām krodha lobha jam
translated: Now listen to violence and theft born of anger and greed.

original: ghātakādarśane nirṇayaḥ
analyzed: ghātaka adarśane nirṇayaḥ
translated: Determination in the absence of a killer

original: kṣatasyālpam ahatvaṃ ca marmasthānaṃ ca yatnataḥ /
analyzed: kṣatasya alpam ahatvam ca marma sthānam ca yatnataḥ
translated: The extent of the injury, the vital part affected, the care (taken of the wound),

original: sāmarthyaṃ cānubandhaṃ ca jñātvā cihnaiḥ prasādayet // / / //
analyzed: sāmarthyam ca anubandham ca jñātvā cihnaiḥ prasādayet
translated: the strength (of the patient), and the nature of the sequelæ, should be ascertained by the marks (of the wound), and the man should be acquitted (of the charge of suicide).

original: hatas tu dṛśyate yatra ghātakaś ca na dṛśyate /
analyzed: hataḥ tu dṛśyate yatra ghātakaḥ ca na dṛśyate
translated: Where a man is found dead, but the murderer is not seen,

original: pūrvavairānusāreṇa jñātavyaḥ sa mahībhujā // / / //🔽samaghātī tu yas teṣāṃ yathoktaṃ dāpayed damam /
analyzed: pūrva vaira anusāreṇa jñātavyaḥ sa mahībhujā  sama ghātī tu yaḥ teṣām yathā uktam dāpayet damam
translated: the king should find out (the criminal) by following up (the traces of) former enmity.🔽But he who has killed another in self-defence, shall be made to pay a fine according to the rule laid down above.

original: ārambhakṛtsahāyaś ca doṣabhājas tad ardhataḥ // / / //
analyzed: ārambha kṛt sahāyaḥ ca doṣa bhājaḥ tat ardhataḥ
translated: He who has begun (the fight), and he who has assisted (the murderer), shall share the guilt, each to the amount of half (the penalty prescribed for the crime).

original: prativeśyānuveśyau ca tasya mitrāribāndhavāḥ /
analyzed: prativeśya ānuveśyau ca tasya mitra ari bāndhavāḥ
translated: The neighbours, the inmates of the house, his friends, enemies, and relations,

original: praṣṭavyā rājapuruṣaiḥ sāmādibhir upakramaiḥ // / / //🔽vijñeyo 'sādhusaṃsargāc cihnahoḍhena vā naraiḥ /
analyzed: praṣṭavyāḥ rāja puruṣaiḥ sāma ādibhiḥ upakramaiḥ  vijñeyaḥ sādhu saṃsargāt cihna hoḍhena vā naraiḥ
translated: shall be examined by the king's officers by conciliation and other (means of negotiation).🔽He shall be found guilty by the marks of guilt (observed on his person), or by the evidence of witnesses, or by the confession (of the accused himself).

original: eṣoditā ghātakānāṃ taskarāṇāṃ ca bhāvanā // / / //
analyzed: eṣā uditā ghātakānām taskarāṇām ca bhāvanā
translated: Thus has been declared the investigation of murderers and thieves.

original: gṛhītaḥ śaṅkayā yas tu na tat kāryaṃ prapadyate /
analyzed: gṛhītaḥ śaṅkayā yaḥ tu na tat kāryam prapadyate
translated: He who, though suspected, does not commit the act (ascribed to him),

original: śapathena viśoddhavyaḥ sarvavādeṣv ayaṃ vidhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: śapathena viśoddhavyaḥ sarva vādeṣu ayam vidhiḥ
translated: shall be cleared by an oath; this is the rule in all suits (between two litigants).

original: divyair viśuddho medhyaḥ syād aśuddho vadham arhati /
analyzed: divyaiḥ viśuddhaḥ medhyaḥ syāt aśuddhaḥ vadham arhati
translated: He who is cleared by the ordeal shall be considered pure; he who is not cleared shall be punished with death.

original: nigrahānugrahair rājñaḥ kīrtir dharmaś ca vardhate // / / //
analyzed: nigraha anugrahaiḥ rājñaḥ kīrtiḥ dharmaḥ ca vardhate
translated: By the punishment and favor of the king, fame and righteousness increase.

original: strīsaṃgrahaṇam
analyzed: strī saṃgrahaṇam
translated: The Seizure of Women

original: pāruṣyaṃ dvividhaṃ proktaṃ sāhasaṃ ca dvilakṣaṇam /
analyzed: pāruṣyam dvividham proktam sāhasam ca dvi lakṣaṇam
translated: Harshness is said to be of two kinds, and violence has two characteristics.

original: pāpamūlaṃ saṃgrahaṇaṃ triprakāraṃ nibodhata // / / //
analyzed: pāpa mūlam saṃgrahaṇam tri prakāram nibodhata
translated: The seizure, which is the root of sin, should be understood to be of three types.

original: balopādhikṛte dve tu tṛtīyam anurāgajam /
analyzed: bala upādhi kṛte dve tu tṛtīyam anurāga jam
translated: Two are caused by force and possession, the third is born of affection.

original: tat punas trividhaṃ proktaṃ prathamaṃ madhyamottamam // / / //
analyzed: tat punar trividham proktam prathamam madhyama uttamam
translated: That is further said to be of three kinds, the first, the middle, and the best.

original: anicchantyā yat kriyate suptonmattapramattayā /
analyzed: an icchantyā yat kriyate supta unmatta pramattayā
translated: When it is done by one who does not desire it, who is asleep, intoxicated, or heedless,

original: pralapantyā vā rahasi balāt kārakṛtaṃ tu tat // / / //
analyzed: pralapantyāḥ vā rahasi balāt kāra kṛtam tu tat
translated: Or by one who is prattling in private, that is done by force.

original: chadmanā gṛham ānīya dattvā vā madyakārmaṇam /
analyzed: chadmanā gṛham ānīya dattvā vā madya kārmaṇam
translated: Having brought her to the house by deception, or having given her intoxicating drugs,

original: saṃyogaḥ kriyate yasyās tadupādhikṛtaṃ viduḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃyogaḥ kriyate yasyāḥ tat upādhi kṛtam viduḥ
translated: If union is made with her, they know it to be done by possession.

original: anyonyacakṣūrāgeṇa dūtīsaṃpreṣaṇena ca /
analyzed: anyonya cakṣuḥ rāgeṇa dūtī saṃpreṣaṇena ca
translated: By mutual glances of love, and by sending a go-between,

original: kṛtaṃ rūpārthalobhena jñeyaṃ tadanurāgajam // / / //
analyzed: kṛtam rūpa artha lobhena jñeyam tat anurāga jam
translated: It should be known as born of affection, done out of greed for beauty and wealth.

original: tat punas trividhaṃ proktaṃ prathamaṃ madhyamottamam /
analyzed: tat punar trividham proktam prathamam madhyama uttamam
translated: That is further said to be of three kinds, the first, the middle, and the best.

original: apāṅgaprekṣaṇaṃ hāsyaṃ dūtīsaṃpreṣaṇaṃ tathā /
analyzed: apāṅga prekṣaṇam hāsyam dūtī saṃpreṣaṇam tathā
translated: Sidelong glances, laughter, and likewise sending a go-between,

original: sparśo bhūṣaṇavastrāṇāṃ saṃgrahaḥ prathamaḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sparśaḥ bhūṣaṇa vastrāṇām saṃgrahaḥ prathamaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The first type of union is considered to be the collection of touch, ornaments, and garments.

original: preṣaṇaṃ gandhamālyānāṃ dhūpam adhvann avāsasām /
analyzed: preṣaṇam gandha mālyānām dhūpam adhvan a vāsasām
translated: Sending of perfumes, garlands, incense, and garments on the road,

original: saṃbhāṣaṇaṃ ca rahasi madhyamaṃ saṃgrahaṃ viduḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃbhāṣaṇam ca rahasi madhyamam saṃgraham viduḥ
translated: and conversing in private - this is known as the medium type of union.

original: ekaśāyyāsanaṃ krīḍā cumbanāliṅganaṃ tathā /
analyzed: eka śāyyā āsanam krīḍā cumbana āliṅganam tathā
translated: Sleeping, sitting, playing, kissing, and embracing together,

original: etat saṃgrahaṇaṃ proktam uttamaṃ śāstravedibhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: etat saṃgrahaṇam proktam uttamam śāstra vedibhiḥ
translated: this is said to be the best type of union by those who know the scriptures.

original: preṣaṇaṃ gandhamālyānāṃ dhūpabhūṣaṇavāsasām /
analyzed: preṣaṇam gandha mālyānām dhūpa bhūṣaṇa vāsasām
translated: Sending of perfumes, garlands, incense, ornaments, and garments,

original: pralobhanaṃ cānnapānair madhyamaḥ saṃgrahaḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pralobhanam ca anna pānaiḥ madhyamaḥ saṃgrahaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: and tempting with food and drink - this is known as the medium type of union.

original: preṣaṇaṃ gandhamālyānāṃ phalamadyānnavāsasām /
analyzed: preṣaṇam gandha mālyānām phala madya anna vāsasām
translated: Sending of perfumes, garlands, fruits, wine, food, and garments,

original: saṃbhāṣaṇaṃ ca rahasi madhyamaṃ saṃgrahaṃ viduḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃbhāṣaṇam ca rahasi madhyamam saṃgraham viduḥ
translated: and conversing in private - this is known as the medium type of union.

original: trayāṇām api caiteṣāṃ prathamo madhya uttamaḥ /
analyzed: trayāṇām api ca eteṣām prathamaḥ madhye uttamaḥ
translated: Of these three, the first is medium and the best,

original: vinayaḥ kalpanīyaḥ syād adhiko draviṇādhike // / / //
analyzed: vinayaḥ kalpanīyaḥ syāt adhikaḥ draviṇa adhike
translated: discipline should be imposed, more so if the wealth is more.

original: parapatnyā tu puruṣaḥ saṃbhāṣāṃ yojayan rahaḥ /
analyzed: para patnyā tu puruṣaḥ saṃbhāṣām yojayan rahaḥ
translated: A man who engages in conversation in private with another's wife,

original: pūrvam ākṣārito doṣaiḥ prāpnuyāt pūrvasāhasam // / / //
analyzed: pūrvam ākṣāritaḥ doṣaiḥ prāpnuyāt pūrvasāhasam
translated: if previously accused of faults, shall incur the first sāhasa.

original: sahamāyaḥ kāmayate dhanaṃ tasyākhilaṃ haret /🔽utkṛtya liṅgavṛṣaṇau bhrāmayed gardabhena tu // / / //
analyzed: saha māyaḥ kāmayate dhanam tasya akhilam haret  utkṛtya liṅga vṛṣaṇau bhrāmayet gardabhena tu
translated: If a man has intercourse with a woman who is protected by her own self, the king should take away all her property.

original: chadmanā kāmayed yas tu tasya sarvaharo damaḥ /
analyzed: chadmanā kāmayet yaḥ tu tasya sarva haraḥ damaḥ
translated: If a man has intercourse with a woman by deceit, the king should take away all his property.

original: aṅkayitvā bhagāṅgena purān nirvāsayet tataḥ // / / //🔽damo neyaḥ sabhāyāṃ yo hīnāyām adhikas tataḥ /🔽puṃsaḥ kāryo 'dhikāyāṃ tu gamane saṃpramāpaṇam // / / //🔽gṛham āgatya yā nārī pralobhya sparśanādinā /
analyzed: aṅkayitvā bhaga aṅgena purāt nirvāsayet tatas  damaḥ neyaḥ sabhāyām yaḥ hīnāyām adhikaḥ tatas  puṃsaḥ kāryaḥ dhikāyām tu gamane saṃpramāpaṇam  gṛham āgatya yā nārī pralobhya sparśana ādinā
translated: Having branded her with the mark of his private parts, he should banish her from the city.🔽If a man has intercourse with a woman who is protected by her own self, the king should take away all her property.🔽If a man has intercourse with a woman who is protected by her own self, the king should take away all her property.

original: kāmayet tatra sā daṇḍyā narasyārdhadamaḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāmayet tatra sā daṇḍyā narasya ardha damaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: If a woman comes to a man's house and seduces him by touching and other means, she should be punished there. For a man, half the punishment is prescribed.

original: chinnanāsauṣṭhakarṇānāṃ paribhrāmyāpsu majjayet /
analyzed: chinna nāsā oṣṭha karṇānām paribhrāmya apsu majjayet
translated: For those whose nose, lips, or ears are cut off, he should make them wander and then drown them in water.

original: khādayed vā sārameyaiḥ saṃsthāne bahusaṃsthite // / / //
analyzed: khādayet vā sārameyaiḥ saṃsthāne bahu saṃsthite
translated: Or he should make them be eaten by dogs in a place frequented by many people.

original: anicchantī tu yā bhuktā guptāṃ tāṃ vāsayed gṛhe /
analyzed: an icchantī tu yā bhuktā guptām tām vāsayet gṛhe
translated: But if an unwilling woman is enjoyed, she should be kept in the house covered.

original: malināṅgīm adhaḥ śayyāṃ piṇḍamātropajīvinīm // / / //🔽kārayen niṣkṛtiṃ kṛcchraṃ parākaṃ vā same gatām /
analyzed: malina aṅgīm adhas śayyām piṇḍa mātra upajīvinīm  kārayet niṣkṛtim kṛcchram parākam vā same gatām
translated: With a dirty body, sleeping on the ground, and subsisting on alms alone.🔽He should make her perform a Krichchhra or a Paraka penance if she has gone to a man of equal caste.

original: hīnavarṇopabhuktā yā tyājyā vadhyātha vā bhavet // / / //
analyzed: hīna varṇa upabhuktā yā tyājyā vadhyā atha vā bhavet
translated: If she has been enjoyed by a man of a lower caste, she should be abandoned or killed.

original: strīpuṃsavartanopāyaḥ
analyzed: strīpuṃsa vartana upāyaḥ
translated: The means of maintaining a wife and husband

original: etat saṃgrahaṇasyoktaṃ vidhānaṃ saṃgrahas tathā /
analyzed: etat saṃgrahaṇasya uktam vidhānam saṃgrahaḥ tathā
translated: This is said to be the procedure of union, and union is

original: strīpuṃsavartanopāyaḥ śrūyatāṃ gadato mama // / / //
analyzed: strīpuṃsa vartana upāyaḥ śrūyatām gadataḥ mama
translated: The means of maintaining a wife and husband. Listen as I speak.

original: sūkṣmebhyo 'pi prasaṅgebhyo nivāryā strī svabandhubhiḥ /
analyzed: sūkṣmebhyaḥ pi prasaṅgebhyaḥ nivāryā strī sva bandhubhiḥ
translated: A woman should be restrained by her relatives from even subtle attachments,

original: śvaśrvādibhir gurustrībhiḥ pālanīyā divāniśam // / / //
analyzed: śvaśrū ādibhiḥ guru strībhiḥ pālanīyāḥ divāniśam
translated: And protected day and night by her mother-in-law and other senior wives.

original: svakāme vartamānā tu yā snehān na nivāritā /
analyzed: sva kāme vartamānā tu yā snehāt na nivāritā
translated: But if a woman who indulges in her own desires is not restrained out of affection,

original: avaśyā sā bhavet paścād yathā vyādhir upekṣitā // / / //
analyzed: avaśyā sā bhavet paścāt yathā vyādhiḥ upekṣitā
translated: She will later become uncontrollable, just as a disease neglected becomes.

original: pitṛpatiputrāṇāṃ dharmāḥ🔽aprayacchan pitā kāle patiś cānupayann ṛtau /
analyzed: pitṛ pati putrāṇām dharmāḥ  a prayacchan pitā kāle patiḥ ca an upayan ṛtau
translated: The duties of fathers, husbands, and sons🔽A father who does not give [his daughter in marriage] at the proper time, a husband who does not have intercourse with his wife at the proper season,

original: putraś cābhaktado mātuḥ gārhyo daṇḍyaś ca dharmataḥ // / / //
analyzed: putraḥ ca abhakta daḥ mātuḥ gārhyaḥ daṇḍyaḥ ca dharmataḥ
translated: And a son who does not provide food to his mother - all are censured and punishable by law.

original: yatra striyo 'bhipūjyante ramante tatra devatāḥ /
analyzed: yatra striyaḥ abhipūjyante ramante tatra devatāḥ
translated: Where women are honored, there the gods rejoice.

original: saṃpadaś ca prajāḥ śuddhāḥ kriyā ca saphalā bhavet // / / //🔽āyavyaye 'nnasaṃskāre gṛhopaskārarakṣaṇe /
analyzed: saṃpadaḥ ca prajāḥ śuddhāḥ kriyā ca saphalā bhavet  āya vyaye nna saṃskāre gṛha upaskāra rakṣaṇe
translated: And wealth, offspring, and purity, and rites, all become fruitful.🔽In income and expenditure, in the preparation of food, in the maintenance of the household, and in cleanliness,

original: śauce 'gnikārye saṃyojyāḥ strīṇāṃ śuddhir iyaṃ smṛtā // / / //
analyzed: śauce gni kārye saṃyojyāḥ strīṇām śuddhiḥ iyam smṛtā
translated: Women should be employed. This is declared to be the purification of women.

original: bhartrā patnī samabhyarcyā vastrālaṃkārabhojanaiḥ /
analyzed: bhartrā patnī samabhyarcyā vastra alaṃkāra bhojanaiḥ
translated: The wife should be honored by her husband with clothes, ornaments, and food.

original: utsave tu pitṛbhrātṛ śvaśurādyaiś ca bandhubhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: utsave tu pitṛ bhrātṛ śvaśura ādyaiḥ ca bandhubhiḥ
translated: And on festive occasions by her father, brothers, father-in-law, and other relatives.

original: patiṃ yā nāticarati manovākkāyasaṃyutā /
analyzed: patim yā na aticarati manaḥ vāc kāya saṃyutā
translated: She who does not transgress her husband in thought, word, or deed,

original: sā bhartṛlokān āpnoti sadbhiḥ sādhvīti cocyate // / / //
analyzed: sā bhartṛ lokān āpnoti sadbhiḥ sādhvī iti ca ucyate
translated: attains the worlds of her husband and is called a virtuous wife by the virtuous.

original: strīdūṣaṇāni
analyzed: strī dūṣaṇāni
translated: Faults of Women

original: bhartrā pitrā sutair na strī viyuktānyagṛhe vaset /
analyzed: bhartrā pitrā sutaiḥ na strī viyuktā anya gṛhe vaset
translated: A woman should not live in another's house without her husband, father, or sons.

original: asatsaṅge viśeṣeṇa garhyatām eti sā dhruvam // / / //
analyzed: asat saṅge viśeṣeṇa garhya tām eti sā dhruvam
translated: Especially in association with the wicked, she certainly becomes reproachable.

original: pūrvotthānaṃ guruṣv arvāg bhojanavyañjanakriyā /🔽jaghanyāsanaśāyitvaṃ karma strīṇām udāhṛtam // / / //
analyzed: pūrva utthānam guruṣu arvāk bhojana vyañjana kriyā  jaghanya āsana śāyi tvam karma strīṇām udāhṛtam
translated: Rising before the elders, serving food and condiments,🔽using inferior seats and beds - this is said to be the duty of women.

original: pānāṭanadivāsvapnam akriyā dūṣaṇaṃ striyāḥ // / / //
analyzed: pāna aṭana divāsvapnam akriyā dūṣaṇam striyāḥ
translated: Drinking, dancing, and sleeping during the day - non-performance of these is a fault for a woman.

original: ārtārte mudite hṛṣṭā proṣite malinā kṛśā /
analyzed: ārta ārte mudite hṛṣṭā proṣite malinā kṛśā
translated: When her husband is afflicted, she is afflicted; when he is happy, she is delighted; when he is away, she is dirty and emaciated.

original: mrte mriyeta yā patyau sā strī jñeyā pativratā // / / //
analyzed: mrte mriyeta yā patyau sā strī jñeyā pativratā
translated: If a woman dies when her husband is dead, she should be known as a chaste wife.

original: prasādhanaṃ nṛttagīta samājotsavadarśanam /
analyzed: prasādhanam nṛtta gīta samāja utsava darśanam
translated: Adorning herself, watching dance, singing, gatherings, and festivals,

original: māṃsamadyābhiyogaṃ ca na kuryāt proṣite prabhau // / / //
analyzed: māṃsa madya abhiyogam ca na kuryāt proṣite prabhau
translated: and indulging in meat and alcohol - she should not do these when her husband is away.

original: śarīrārdhaṃ smṛtā jāyā puṇyāpuṇyaphale samā /
analyzed: śarīra ardham smṛtā jāyā puṇya apuṇya phale samā
translated: A wife is considered half of one's body, equal in the fruits of merit and demerit.

original: anvārūḍhā jīvatīntī ca sādhvī bhartur hittaya sā // / / //
analyzed: anvārūḍhā jīvatī intī ca sādhvī bhartuḥ sā
translated: And a chaste woman who follows her dead husband, lives for the welfare of her husband.

original: vratopavāsaniratā brahmacarye vyavasthitā /
analyzed: vrata upavāsa niratā brahmacarye vyavasthitā
translated: Devoted to vows and fasts, established in celibacy,

original: dharmadānaparā nityam aputrāpi divaṃ vrajet // / / //
analyzed: dharma dāna parā nityam aputrā api divam vrajet
translated: Always engaged in giving religious gifts, even a childless woman goes to heaven.

original: niyoganisedhaḥ
analyzed: niyoga nisedhaḥ
translated: Prohibition of Niyoga

original: uktvā niyogo manunā niṣiddhaḥ svayam eva tu /
analyzed: uktvā niyogaḥ manunā niṣiddhaḥ svayam eva tu
translated: Manu himself, after mentioning Niyoga, has prohibited it.

original: yugahrāsād aśakyo 'yaṃ kartuṃ sarvair vidhānataḥ // / / //
analyzed: yuga hrāsāt aśakyaḥ yam kartum sarvaiḥ vidhānataḥ
translated: Due to the decrease in the yugas, this cannot be performed by all according to the rules.

original: tapojñānasamāyuktāḥ kṛte tretāyuge narāḥ /
analyzed: tapaḥ jñāna samāyuktāḥ kṛte tretā yuge narāḥ
translated: In the Kṛta and Tretā yugas, men are endowed with austerity and knowledge.

original: dvāpare ca kalau nṛṇāṃ śaktihānir vinirmitā // / / //
analyzed: dvāpare ca kalau nṛṇām śakti hāniḥ vinirmitā
translated: In the Dvāpara and Kali yugas, the capacity of men is diminished.

original: dāyabhāgaḥ
analyzed: dāya bhāgaḥ
translated: Division of Inheritance

original: dadāti dīyate pitrā putrebhyaḥ svasya yad dhanam /
analyzed: dadāti dīyate pitrā putrebhyaḥ svasya yat dhanam
translated: What wealth a father gives to his sons, he gives it to them.

analyzed: tat dāyam
translated: That is Dāya (inheritance).

original: ekāṃ strīṃ kārayet karma yathāṃśena gṛhe gṛhe /
analyzed: ekām strīm kārayet karma yathā aṃśena gṛhe gṛhe
translated: One woman should be made to do the work in each house according to her share.

original: bahvyaḥ samāṃśato deyā dāsānām apy ayaṃ vidhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: bahvyaḥ sama aṃśataḥ deyāḥ dāsānām api ayam vidhiḥ
translated: Many should be given according to equal shares. This rule applies even to slaves.

original: uddhṛtya kūpavāpyambhas tv anusāreṇa gṛhyate /
analyzed: uddhṛtya kūpa vāpī ambhaḥ tu anusāreṇa gṛhyate
translated: Water from wells and tanks is taken according to the order.

original: tathā bhāgānusāreṇa setuḥ kṣetraṃ vibhajyate // / / //
analyzed: tathā bhāga anusāreṇa setuḥ kṣetram vibhajyate
translated: Similarly, a dike is constructed to divide the field according to the shares.

original: yuktyā vibhajanīyaṃ tad anyathānarthakaṃ bhavet // / / //
analyzed: yuktyā vibhajanīyam tat anyathā anarthakam bhavet
translated: That should be divided by reason, otherwise it would be useless.

original: vibhaktalakṣaṇam
translated: The definition of division

original: ekapākena vasatāṃ pitṛdevadvijārcanam /
analyzed: eka pākena vasatām pitṛ deva dvija arcanam
translated: For those living together in one cooking, the worship of ancestors, gods and Brahmins,

original: ekaṃ bhaved dvibhaktānāṃ tad eva syād gṛhe gṛhe // / / //
analyzed: ekam bhavet dvi bhaktānām tat eva syāt gṛhe gṛhe
translated: would be one for those with two divisions, that alone would be in each house.

original: sāksitvaṃ pratibhāvyaṃ ca dānaṃ grahaṇam eva ca /
analyzed: sāksitvam pratibhāvyam ca dānam grahaṇam eva ca
translated: Testifying, surety, giving and taking,

original: vibhaktā bhrātaraḥ kuryuḥ nāvibhaktāḥ parasparam // / / //
analyzed: vibhaktāḥ bhrātaraḥ kuryuḥ na avibhaktāḥ parasparam
translated: should be done by divided brothers, not by those not divided among each other.

original: yeṣām etāḥ kriyā loke pravartante svarikthiṣu /
analyzed: yeṣām etāḥ kriyāḥ loke pravartante svarikthiṣu
translated: For those among whom these rites are performed in the world on their own property,

original: vibhaktān avagaccheyuḥ lekhyam apy antareṇa tān // / / //
analyzed: vibhaktān avagaccheyuḥ lekhyam api antareṇa tān
translated: they should be considered divided, even without a written document.

original: kulānubandhavyāghāta hodhaṃ sāhasasādhakam /
analyzed: kula anubandha vyāghāta sāhasa sādhakam
translated: Causing obstruction to the continuity of the family, and the accomplishment of violence,

original: svasvabhogasthāvarasya vibhāgasya pṛthagdhanam // / / //
analyzed: sva sva bhoga sthāvarasya vibhāgasya pṛthak dhanam
translated: are separate wealth for the division of one's own enjoyment and immovable property.

original: vibhāgakālaḥ
analyzed: vibhāga kālaḥ
translated: The time of division

original: pitror abhāve bhrātṛṇāṃ vibhāgaḥ saṃpradarśitaḥ /
analyzed: pitroḥ abhāve bhrātṛṇām vibhāgaḥ saṃpradarśitaḥ
translated: In the absence of parents, the division of brothers has been shown.

original: mātur nivṛtte rajasi prattasu bhaginīṣu ca // / / //
analyzed: mātuḥ nivṛtte rajasi prattasu bhaginīṣu ca
translated: After the cessation of the mother's menstruation, and when the sisters have attained puberty.

original: vibhāgakramaḥ🔽kramāgate gṛhakṣetre pitā putrāḥ samāṃśinaḥ /
analyzed: vibhāga kramaḥ  krama āgate gṛha kṣetre pitā putrāḥ sama aṃśinaḥ
translated: The order of division🔽In the house and field that has come down through inheritance, the father and sons have equal shares.

original: paitṛke na vibhāgārhāḥ sutāḥ pitur anicchayā // / / //
analyzed: paitṛke na vibhāga arhāḥ sutāḥ pituḥ anicchayā
translated: The sons are not entitled to division of the paternal property without the father's consent.

original: samavarṇāsu ye jātāḥ sarve putrā dvijanmanām /
analyzed: sama varṇāsu ye jātāḥ sarve putrāḥ dvijanmanām
translated: All the sons born to twice-born men from wives of the same class

original: uddhāraṃ jyāyase dattvā bhajerann itare samam // / / //
analyzed: uddhāram jyāyase dattvā bhajeran itare samam
translated: should divide the estate equally, after giving an additional share to the eldest.

original: vayovidyātapobhiś ca dvyaṃśaṃ hi labhate dhanam /🔽yathā yathā vibhāgāptaṃ dhanaṃ yāgārthatām iyāt /
analyzed: vayaḥ vidyā tapobhiḥ ca dvi aṃśam hi labhate dhanam  yathā yathā vibhāga āptam dhanam yāga artha tām iyāt
translated: One obtains a double share of the property by age, learning, and austerities.🔽To the extent that the property obtained through division is used for sacrifices,

original: tathā tathā vidhātavyaṃ vidvadbhir bhāgagauravam // / / //
analyzed: tathā tathā vidhātavyam vidvadbhiḥ bhāga gauravam
translated: to that extent should the learned determine the value of the shares.

original: tatputrā viṣamasamāḥ pitṛbhāgaharāḥ smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tad putrāḥ viṣama samāḥ pitṛ bhāga harāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The sons of such a man, whether equal or unequal, are considered to inherit their father's share.

original: dravye pitāmahopātte sthāvare jaṅgame 'pi vā /
analyzed: dravye pitāmaha upātte sthāvare jaṅgame vā
translated: In a property inherited from the grandfather, whether immovable or movable,

original: samam aṃśitvam ākhyātaṃ pituḥ putrasya caiva hi // / / //
analyzed: samam aṃśi tvam ākhyātam pituḥ putrasya ca eva hi
translated: the father and the son are declared to have equal shares.

original: samanyūnādhikā bhāgāḥ pitrā yeṣāṃ prakalpitāḥ /
analyzed: sama nyūna adhikāḥ bhāgāḥ pitrā yeṣām prakalpitāḥ
translated: Those whose shares have been determined by the father as equal, less, or more,

original: tathaiva te pālanīyā vineyās te syur anyathā // / / //
analyzed: tathā eva te pālanīyāḥ vineyāḥ te syuḥ anyathā
translated: should be maintained as such; they should not be treated otherwise.

original: jīvadvibhāge tu pitā gṛhṇītāṃśadvayaṃ svakam // / / //
analyzed: jīvat vibhāge tu pitā gṛhṇīta aṃśa dvayam svakam
translated: But in a division while the father is alive, the father may take two shares for himself.

original: dviprakāro vibhāgas tu dāyādānāṃ prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: dvi prakāraḥ vibhāgaḥ tu dāyādānām prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The division of heirs is declared to be of two kinds:

original: vayojyeṣṭhakrameṇaikaḥ samā parāṃśakalpanā // / / //
analyzed: vayaḥ jyeṣṭha krameṇa ekaḥ samā para aṃśa kalpanā
translated: one is based on seniority by age, the other on equal shares.

original: samavetais tu yat prāptaṃ sarve tatra samāṃśinaḥ /
analyzed: samavetaiḥ tu yat prāptam sarve tatra sama aṃśinaḥ
translated: But all are equal sharers in what is obtained jointly.

original: tatputrā viṣamasamāḥ pitṛbhāgaharāḥ smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tad putrāḥ viṣama samāḥ pitṛ bhāga harāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: Their sons, equal in status, are declared to be entitled to their father's share.

original: pitṛrikthaharāḥ putrāḥ sarva eva samāṃśinaḥ /
analyzed: pitṛ riktha harāḥ putrāḥ sarve eva sama aṃśinaḥ
translated: All sons are entitled to an equal share of the father's estate.

original: vidyākarmaratas teṣām adhikaṃ labdhum arhati // / / //
analyzed: vidyā karma rataḥ teṣām adhikam labdhum arhati
translated: Among them, he who is devoted to learning and action deserves to receive more.

original: vidyāvijñānaśauryārthe jñānadānakriyāsu ca /
analyzed: vidyā vijñāna śaurya arthe jñāna dāna kriyāsu ca
translated: For the sake of learning, knowledge, and valor, and for the performance of acts of knowledge and charity,

original: yasyeha prathitā kīrtitaḥ pitaras tena putriṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yasya iha prathitā kīrtitaḥ pitaraḥ tena putriṇaḥ
translated: he whose fame is proclaimed here is said to have sons.

original: janmavidyāguṇair jyeṣṭho dvyaṃśaṃ dāyād avāpnuyāt /
analyzed: janma vidyā guṇaiḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ dvi aṃśam dāyāt avāpnuyāt
translated: The eldest son, by birth and learning, shall receive two shares.

original: samāṃśabhāginas tv anye teṣāṃ pitṛsamas tu saḥ // / / //
analyzed: sama aṃśa bhāginaḥ tu anye teṣām pitṛ samaḥ tu saḥ
translated: The others shall have equal shares, and he is equal to the father.

original: tadabhāve tu jananī tanayāṃśasamāṃśinī /
analyzed: tad abhāve tu jananī tanaya aṃśa sama aṃśinī
translated: In the absence of that, the mother shall have a share equal to that of a son.

original: samāṃśā mātaras teṣāṃ turīyāṃśā ca kanyakā // / / //
analyzed: sama aṃśāḥ mātaraḥ teṣām turīya aṃśā ca kanyakā
translated: The mothers shall have equal shares, and the daughter a quarter share.

original: kanyakānāṃ tv adattānāṃ caturtho bhāga iṣyate /
analyzed: kanyakānām tu adattānām caturthaḥ bhāgaḥ iṣyate
translated: For unmarried daughters, a quarter share is prescribed.

original: putrāṇāṃ ca trayo bhāgāḥ sāmyaṃ tv alpadhane smṛtam // / / //
analyzed: putrāṇām ca trayaḥ bhāgāḥ sāmyam tu alpa dhane smṛtam
translated: For sons, three shares are prescribed. Equality is prescribed in the case of little wealth.

original: yady ekajātā bahavaḥ samānā jātisaṃkhyayā /
analyzed: yadi eka jātāḥ bahavaḥ samānāḥ jāti saṃkhyayā
translated: If there are many brothers born of the same mother, of equal caste and number,

original: svadhanais tair vibhaktavyaṃ mātṛbhāgena dharmataḥ // / / //
analyzed: sva dhanaiḥ taiḥ vibhaktavyam mātṛ bhāgena dharmataḥ
translated: they should divide their mother's share according to their own wealth, according to dharma.

original: savarṇā bhinnasaṃkhyā ye puṃbhāgas teṣu śasyate /
analyzed: savarṇāḥ bhinna saṃkhyāḥ ye puṃbhāgaḥ teṣu śasyate
translated: For those of the same caste but different numbers, a share equal to that of the sons is recommended.

original: pitāmahyas tu sarvās tā mātṛtulyāḥ prakīrtitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: pitāmahyaḥ tu sarvāḥ tāḥ mātṛ tulyāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: But all the grandmothers are declared to be equal to the mother.

original: asaṃskṛtās tu yās tatra paitṛkād eva tā dhanāt /
analyzed: a saṃskṛtāḥ tu yāḥ tatra paitṛkāt eva tāḥ dhanāt
translated: But those who are not consecrated there, they should be consecrated from the paternal property itself.

original: saṃskāryā bhrātṛbhir jyeṣṭhaḥ kanyakāś ca yathāvidhi // / / //
analyzed: saṃskāryāḥ bhrātṛbhiḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ kanyakāḥ ca yathāvidhi
translated: The elder brothers should consecrate the unmarried daughters according to the prescribed procedure.

original: asaṃskṛtā bhrātaras tu ye syus tatra yavīyasaḥ /
analyzed: a saṃskṛtāḥ bhrātaraḥ tu ye syuḥ tatra yavīyasaḥ
translated: But those who are not consecrated there, the younger brothers,

original: saṃskāryāḥ pūrvajais te vai paitṛkān madhyagād dhanāt // / / //
analyzed: saṃskāryāḥ pūrvajaiḥ te vai paitṛkāt madhya gāt dhanāt
translated: they should be consecrated by the elder ones from the paternal property.

original: dadyād dhanaṃ ca paryāptaṃ kṣetrāṃśaṃ vā yad icchati // / / //
analyzed: dadyāt dhanam ca paryāptam kṣetra aṃśam vā yat icchati
translated: And he should give sufficient wealth or a share of the field as he wishes.

original: ūḍhayā kanyayā vāpi bhartuḥ pitṛgṛhe 'pi vā /
analyzed: ūḍhayā kanyayā vā api bhartuḥ pitṛ gṛhe vā
translated: By a married daughter or even in the father's house,

original: bhrātuḥ sakāśāt pitror vā labdhaṃ saudāyikaṃ smṛtam // / / //
analyzed: bhrātuḥ sakāśāt pitroḥ vā labdham saudāyikam smṛtam
translated: what is obtained from the brother or the parents is known as the dowry.

original: saudāyikaṃ dhanaṃ prāpya strīṇāṃ svātantram iṣyate /
analyzed: saudāyikam dhanam prāpya strīṇām svātantram iṣyate
translated: Having obtained the dowry, independence is desired for women,

original: yasmāt tadānṛśaṃsyārthaṃ tair dattam upajīvanam // / / //
analyzed: yasmāt tad ānṛśaṃsya artham taiḥ dattam upajīvanam
translated: because for the sake of non-cruelty, they are given a livelihood by them.

original: vikraye caiva dāne ca yatheṣtaṃ sthāvareṣv api /
analyzed: vikraye ca eva dāne ca yatheṣtam sthāvareṣu api
translated: And in the sale and gift, even in immovable properties as they wish,

original: strīdhanaṃ syād apatyānāṃ duhitā ca tadaṃśinī /
analyzed: strīdhanam syāt apatyānām duhitā ca tad aṃśinī
translated: the dowry should be the property of the children, and the daughter is a sharer of it.

original: aprattā cet samūḍhā tu labhate mānamātrakam // / / //
analyzed: aprattā ced samūḍhā tu labhate māna mātrakam
translated: If she is not given in marriage, but is married, she obtains only honor.

original: mātuḥ svasā mātulānī pitṛvyastrī pitṛṣvasā /
analyzed: mātuḥ svasā mātulānī pitṛvya strī pitṛṣvasā
translated: The sister of the mother, the wife of the maternal uncle, the wife of the paternal uncle, the wife of the father's younger brother,

original: śvaśrūḥ pūrvajapatnī ca mātṛtulyāḥ prakīrtitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: śvaśrūḥ pūrvaja patnī ca mātṛ tulyāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: and the wife of the father-in-law are declared to be equal to the mother.

original: yad āsām auraso na syāt putro dauhitra eva vā /
analyzed: yat āsām aurasaḥ na syāt putraḥ dauhitraḥ eva vā
translated: If they have no son born of themselves or a daughter's son,

original: tat suto vā dhanaṃ tāsāṃ svastrīyād yāḥ samāpnuyuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat sutaḥ vā dhanam tāsām svastrī iyāt yāḥ samāpnuyuḥ
translated: then their son or the son of their daughter shall inherit their property.

original: putralakṣaṇam
analyzed: putra lakṣaṇam
translated: The characteristics of a son

original: savarṇajo 'py aguṇavān nārhaḥ syāt paitṛke dhane /
analyzed: savarṇajaḥ pi aguṇavān na arhaḥ syāt paitṛke dhane
translated: Even a son of the same caste, if he is devoid of good qualities, is not entitled to the paternal property.

original: tatpiṇḍadāḥ śrotriyā ye teṣāṃ tat tu vidhīyate // / / //
analyzed: tad piṇḍa dāḥ śrotriyāḥ ye teṣām tat tu vidhīyate
translated: But it is prescribed that the sons who offer funeral cakes and are learned in the Vedas shall receive it.

original: uttamarṇādhamarṇebhyaḥ pitaraṃ trāyate sutaḥ /
analyzed: uttamarṇa adhamarṇebhyaḥ pitaram trāyate sutaḥ
translated: A son rescues the father from the lower realms of the creditors and debtors.

original: atas tu viparītena tena nāsti prayojanam // / / //
analyzed: atas tu viparītena tena na asti prayojanam
translated: But if it is the reverse, then he is of no use.

original: tayā gavā kiṃ kriyate yā na dogdhrī na garbhiṇī /🔽ko 'rthaḥ putreṇa jātena yo na vidvān na dhārmikaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tayā gavā kim kriyate yā na dogdhrī na garbhiṇī  kaḥ rthaḥ putreṇa jātena yaḥ na vidvān na dhārmikaḥ
translated: What is the use of a cow that does not yield milk or carry loads?🔽What is the use of a son who is neither learned nor righteous?

original: śāstraśauryārtharahitas tapovijñānavarjitaḥ /
analyzed: śāstra śaurya artha rahitaḥ tapaḥ vijñāna varjitaḥ
translated: He who is devoid of scriptures, bravery, and wealth, and of austerities and knowledge,

original: ācārahīnaḥ putras tu mūtroccārasamaḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ācāra hīnaḥ putraḥ tu mūtra uccāra samaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: and who lacks good conduct, is said to be like urine and excrement.

original: putravibhāgaḥ
analyzed: putra vibhāgaḥ
translated: The division of sons

original: sthāvaradvipadaṃ caiva yady api svayam ārhitam /
analyzed: sthāvara dvipadam ca eva yadi api svayam
translated: Even if a son is acquired by oneself, whether he is a quadruped or a biped,

original: asambhūya sutān sarvān na dānaṃ na ca vikrayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: a sambhūya sutān sarvān na dānam na ca vikrayaḥ
translated: Without having begotten sons, there is neither gift nor sale.

original: jātā janiṣyad garbhasthāḥ pitṛsthā ye ca mānavāḥ /
analyzed: jātā janiṣyat garbha sthāḥ pitṛ sthāḥ ye ca mānavāḥ
translated: All men, whether born, to be born, or in the womb, or in the father,

original: sarve kāṃkṣanti tāṃ vṛttim anācchedyās tatas tu sā // / / //
analyzed: sarve kāṃkṣanti tām vṛttim anācchedyāḥ tatas tu sā
translated: all desire that subsistence, and therefore it is not to be taken away.

original: gṛhopaskaravāhyādi bhojyābharaṇakarmiṇaḥ /
analyzed: gṛha upaskara vāhya ādi bhojya ābharaṇa karmiṇaḥ
translated: Household utensils, vehicles, etc., food, ornaments, and servants,

original: dṛśyamānā vibhajyante gūḍhe keśo vidhīyate // / / //🔽kṣatrajās tridvyekabhāgā viḍjau tu dvyekabhāginau // / / //🔽brahmaksatriyaviṣśūdrā viprotpannās tv anukramāt /
analyzed: dṛśyamānāḥ vibhajyante gūḍhe keśaḥ vidhīyate  kṣatra jāḥ tri dvi eka bhāgāḥ viś jau tu dvi eka bhāginau  brahma ksatriya viṣ śūdrāḥ vipra utpannāḥ tu anukramāt
translated: when seen, are to be divided; in secret, the hair is to be determined.🔽The sons of the Kshatriya and Vaishya get two and one shares respectively, while the son of the Shudra gets only one share.

original: catustridvyekabhāgena bhaveyus te yathākramam // / / //
analyzed: catur tri dvi eka bhāgena bhaveyuḥ te yathākramam
translated: The sons of the Brahmana, Kshatriya, Vaishya, and Shudra by a Brahmani woman get respectively four, three, two, and one shares.

original: śūdryāṃ dvijātibhir jāto na bhūmer bhāgam arhati /
analyzed: śūdryām dvijātibhiḥ jātaḥ na bhūmeḥ bhāgam arhati
translated: A son born to a Shudra woman by twice-born men does not deserve a share in the land.

original: dvijātir āpnuyāt sarvam iti dharmo vyavasthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dvijātiḥ āpnuyāt sarvam iti dharmaḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: It is the settled law that a twice-born man shall get everything.

original: teṣāṃ savarṇā ye putrās te tṛtīyāṃśabhāginaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām savarṇāḥ ye putrāḥ te tṛtīya aṃśa bhāginaḥ
translated: Those sons who are of the same caste as their fathers get one-third of the share.

original: hīnās tam upajīveyur grāsācchādanasaṃbhṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: hīnāḥ tam upajīveyuḥ grāsa ācchādana saṃbhṛtāḥ
translated: The inferior ones should live on him, supported by food, clothing, and provisions.

original: sarve hy anaurasasyaite putrā dāyaharāḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: sarve hi anaurasasya ete putrāḥ dāya harāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: All these sons, not born of one's own loins, are declared to be entitled to inheritances.

original: aurase punar utpanne teṣu jyaiṣṭhyaṃ na tiṣṭhati // / / //
analyzed: aurase punar utpanne teṣu jyaiṣṭhyam na tiṣṭhati
translated: When a son is born through the wife, their seniority does not stand.

original: pitāmahapitṛbhyāṃ ca dattaṃ mātrā ca yad bhavet /
